narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra Prats
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra Prats
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra was incredibly organized, helpful, and knowledgable. She led excellent and useful review sessions before exams. Go Kyra!
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra Prats was very knowledgeable, helpful and affable. She was ready to help when needed, and showed enthusiasm while doing so. I would rate her very high as a Teaching Assistant. There were no evident weaknesses.
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra was absolutely wonderful, always helpful, knowledgeable, and organized.
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  She did a great job.
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  Kyra was very helpful and went above and beyond
Instructor: Kyra Alexandra Prats  She was really helpful, put together very useful study guides was in general very receptive and responsive.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: One of the best classes I've taken at FES thus far. Well structured, aptly taught, and both professors were engaging.
Great course, and very useful.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: It was very specific, right to the point. It covered the right amount of important plant families, avoiding the lesser important ones, given the time available for the entire semester. The professors were very knowledgeable, and were experts in what they do. Moreover, they were were very friendly, understanding and helpful.
The Costa Rica field trip was incredible. I definitely learned more on the trip than I ever could have in the classroom. It would have been great to visit the greenhouse or the NYBG as well.
Obviously, the trip to Costa Rica is a highlight. Cuerici was an especially enlightening visit.
The field trip was wonderful

The field trip included three different ecosystem types on one of the most biodiverse countries in the world, which gave us a lot of experience with plants that will be useful anywhere. The material brought to class was amazing!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: (1) Though the course in on Tropical Field Botany, it covers only neotropical regions. Students working in tropical Asia and Africa would have benefited more, if there was some focus to cover important plant families in the Old World as well. (2) The course is heavily on plant identification to family-level. Field botany is more than that, and it should involve lab sessions on field collection and storage of samples and field measurement of traits.
I thought the course was excellent and my only suggestion would be to include a possible field trip to the NYBG or another mini-field trip.

I know it is difficult to teach botany to a group who has very little experience, and time is limited, but I think it would have been helpful to learn some more natural history behind the different families. I think this would help associate the plant families with certain traits.
clarity of how to organize notes

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The lecture and the lab sections synced very well. I do not see how it can be further improved. One improvement could be the classroom (Marsh Rotunda), which is not suited for a lab (or lecture), with random people moving through the classroom, as the Rotunda is not designed to hold a class, and as it is the only space that connects the front door to the rest of the building. The classes could be in the Peabody Museum building with increased and easy access to the collection.
I thought the mix between lecture and lab was perfect. Each class was about an hour of lecture and then 2 hours of actually looking at plant features. Could not have been done any better.
I appreciated having the lectures and then immediately looking at all the plant samples afterward.
yes.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course directly influences my research, which is on tropical plants. This is a perfect fit for my plans.
It helps me understand biodiversity in the tropics. Useful for understanding forest impacts, uses of biodiversity

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I work on tropical plants, and identifying plants in the field is an important part of the research I do. I needed skill-sets to do that, and this class fills the blanks

I took this course as an elective and as preparation for my summer research. Although my research is more wildlife-based, the deeper understanding of botany will be extremely helpful for me in the field.

I thought it would be a useful skill to at least be familiar with. As someone who studies ecology, specifically through the lens of plants, it is important to understand the taxonomy behind flora throughout the world.
I wanted to know more about biodiversity managed in forestry.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: To a big extent, yes. Could have been 100%, had the course included field sample collection and measurement.
Yes! I learned more from this class than I could have expected.
Yes, I am pleased with how much I was able to learn in this course in one semester.
Yes
yes!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: (1) If you need an intro/refresher class into plant identification in the tropics, this could be an excellent class; (2) Take this class if you wish to be taught by two scientists with excellent knowledge of plants, and who are as friendly as they could. No one is going to take you less seriously, for the greenhorn you might be; (3) If you work in the Old World, think about getting books/resources beyond the class; however, this class will greatly benefit you if you are a botanist anywhere; (4) Being the only such class in the whole of Yale, you shouldn't miss it even if you are not specifically studying plants. This will open your mindscapes towards the amazing plant diversity out there.
Start studying as early as possible! Literally look over your notes on a regular basis so that the information is memorized by the time you take the midterm and final.
Take it!
Useful, even if you don't think you'll use botany directly
Highly recommended! Really useful practical knowledge. Plus you get to see awesome plants and the field trip is amazing.
